summary: The Domestic Workers Bill of Rights Act aims to enhance the rights and protections of domestic employees. It amends the Fair Labor Standards Act to include overtime protections for live-in employees and establishes termination notice requirements. The bill mandates written agreements, earned sick days, fair scheduling, and privacy protections. It also establishes a Domestic Employee Standards Board, funds a national hotline, and provides grants for community-based education and enforcement. Additionally, it addresses federal funding for Medicaid-funded services by domestic employees and includes provisions for delayed enforcement and severability.
